items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers levels remain high following heavy rainfall last night. As a result, this Flood Alert remains in force. Further rain is forecast tomorrow from 12:00PM. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station has risen to 8.57m. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.1m. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. Pumping operations will continue when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 17 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Due to the heavy rain last night, The River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station is now at 7.45m. Water will enter Currymoor reservoir via Hookbridge spillway if this level exceeds 7.45m.

The drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 4.93m. Cutts Road floods when this level is above 5.75m, and New Road when the level is above 6.18m. Please refer to the Somerset Council website for information on road closures in the area. Pumping will commence at Currymoor when river levels allow.

Further rainfall is forecast for the rest of today and and tomorrow. This flood alert will remain out as rivers are expected to rise in response to the rainfall. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 17 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Plym from Shaugh Bridge to Riverside Caravan Park
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. However, more rainfall is expected Wednesday 17th  and Thursday 18th December 2025. Catchments are saturated and rivers remain responsive. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Tone from Waterrow to Taunton
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.
